summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2012 CHRYSLER 200. UPON STARTING THE VEHICLE, THE AIR BAG INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT PREVIOUSLY RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 16V668000 (SEAT BELTS, AIR BAGS). THE PART TO DO THE REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE AND STATED THAT PARTS FOR THE RECALL REPAIR WERE NOT AVAILABLE AND THAT THEY DID NOT KNOW WHETHER THE AIR BAG INDICATOR ILLUMINATING WAS DUE TO THE RECALL OR NOT. THE CONTACT SPOKE TO CENTRAL JEEP CHRYSLER DODGE RAM OF NORWOOD (56 BOSTON-PROVIDENCE TURNPIKE, NORWOOD, MA 02062) WHO STATED THAT PARTS FOR THE RECALL REPAIR WERE NOT AVAILABLE; HOWEVER, THEY COULD DIAGNOSE THE FAILURE FOR A FEE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 115,000. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.
